block.p: Eleanor Thurston Green, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Marshall M. Green of Fairfield, Conn., was married in New York yesterday to William Nicholas Carlough 3d, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Carlough Jr. of Charlotte, N.C. The Rev. Donald R. Goodness performed the Episcopal ceremony at the Church of the Ascension.

Mrs. Carlough, 28 years old, is a development officer at St. Vincent's Hospital and Medical Center in New York. She graduated from Mount Holyoke College. Her father is of counsel to the New York law firm of LeBoeuf, Lamb, Leiby & MacRae.

Eleanor Thurston Green, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Marshall M. Green of Fairfield, Conn., was married in New York yesterday to William Nicholas Carlough 3d, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Carlough Jr. of Charlotte, N.C. The Rev. Donald R. Goodness performed the Episcopal ceremony at the Church of the Ascension.

Mrs. Carlough, 28 years old, is a development officer at St. Vincent's Hospital and Medical Center in New York. She graduated from Mount Holyoke College. Her father is of counsel to the New York law firm of LeBoeuf, Lamb, Leiby & MacRae.

Mr. Carlough, 28, is known as Nicholas. He is a merchandise analyst at the Ann Taylor Corporation in New York, the clothing store chain. He graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. His mother, Kathleen Carlough, is a staff planner in Charlotte for the systems technology division of the International Business Machines Corporation, a position also held by the bridegroom's father before his retirement.
